AttackModel.NameOfTheChallenge: SSRF using Gopher protocol leads to tampering of Redis key-value store

Vulnerabilities: SSRF vulnerability allowing LFI via file:// protocol
Insecure Redis configuration allowing unauthorized access

Steps.Description: Exploit SSRF vulnerability to retrieve server code

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker's goal is to view the server code to gain more information about the target system.
StepDetails.Action: Send a POST request with the URL parameter set to file:///code/app.py
StepDetails.Result: The server code is retrieved and displayed in the response.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to understand the role of Redis in the application and identify potential attack vectors.
StepDetails.Action: Analyze the retrieved server code and identify Redis-related functions and configurations.
StepDetails.Result: The server code reveals the usage of Redis for storing user data and flag information.

Steps.Description: Exploit SSRF vulnerability to tamper with Redis data

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to modify the <userID>_isAdmin key in the Redis database to gain administrative privileges.
StepDetails.Action: Send a POST request with the URL parameter set to inctf://redis:6379/_SET <userID>_isAdmin "yes"
StepDetails.Result: The <userID>_isAdmin value in the Redis database is modified to "yes".
